channel.title: Starting outfit\armour
channel.description: All the tuts say that you need to go to player.java and search "unique" or something like that. I don't have that. Can you please help me figure out what to change to make it so that when you make a new character you are WEARING the items.

item.title: Starting outfit\armour
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

lesterknome:

In player.java in it’s constructer where it resets the character before loading it; there is the equipment it resets to, add it there and then if it can’t be loaded, it will be kept to the armour set.

In “coding for dummys” language please?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 26, 2009, 07:44:29 pm[/size][hr]

Read full topic

item.title: Starting outfit\armour
item.dc:creator: @lesterknome lesterknome
item.description:
@lesterknome wrote:

In player.java in it’s constructer where it resets the character before loading it; there is the equipment it resets to, add it there and then if it can’t be loaded, it will be kept to the armour set.

item.title: Starting outfit\armour

item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

this?

// Setting player standard look playerLook[0] = 2; playerLook[1] = 6; playerLook[2] = 7; playerLook[3] = 10; playerLook[4] = 5; playerLook[5] = 0;

Read full topic

item.title: Starting outfit\armour
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

That’s all I have.

In Player.java
Search //giving a player

or search initial

If you see initial x and y coordinates of the player scroll up and you should see your starting outfit info, as I have in my previous post.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting outfit\armour
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

[quote=“Epic Ancient, post:6, topic:297519”]You don’t change the 0,1,2,3,etc. You change the numbers after them?

Like… This is mine, for skeletal starting outfit:

playerEquipment[playerHat]=6137; playerEquipment[playerCape]=1052; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=1725; playerEquipment[playerChest]=6139; playerEquipment[playerShield]=3840; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=6141; playerEquipment[playerHands]=6153; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=6147; playerEquipment[playerRing]=6737; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=882; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=1323;[/quote]
what numbers after them?

Read full topic

item.title: Starting outfit\armour
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

You don’t change the 0,1,2,3,etc. You change the numbers after them?

Like… This is mine, for skeletal starting outfit:

playerEquipment[playerHat]=6137; playerEquipment[playerCape]=1052; playerEquipment[playerAmulet]=1725; playerEquipment[playerChest]=6139; playerEquipment[playerShield]=3840; playerEquipment[playerLegs]=6141; playerEquipment[playerHands]=6153; playerEquipment[playerFeet]=6147; playerEquipment[playerRing]=6737; playerEquipment[playerArrows]=882; playerEquipment[playerWeapon]=1323;

item.title: Starting outfit\armour
item.dc:creator: @T33J4Y T33J4Y
item.description:
@T33J4Y wrote:

kingofnone:

oh shit this dudes got 16 rep and doesn’t know how to change starting armor?!

Dude… are you retarted? Rep means nothing, ESPECIALLY on moparscape forums. If you think reputation is everything then you’re ignorant.

This is what I have in player.java

public int playerHat = 0; public int playerCape = 1; public int playerAmulet = 2; public int playerWeapon = 3; public int playerChest = 4; public int playerShield = 5; public int playerLegs = 7; public int playerHands = 9; public int playerFeet = 10; public int playerRing = 12; public int playerArrows = 13;
If I change any of the numbers, the server messes up.

Read full topic

Either or

most likely…

Search in Player.Java (CTRL+F) “playerhat” and edit the id after it. it’s pretty self explanatory after that.
